longTitle.p: COUNCIL DECISION (CFSP) 2020/252of 25 February 2020amending Decision (CFSP) 2018/904 extending the mandate of the European Union Special Representative for Central Asia

formula.name: actingEntity
formula.p: THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION,

citation.p: Having regard to the Treaty on European Union, and in particular Article 33 and Article 31(2) thereof,
Having regard to the proposal from the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy,

recital.p:
On 15 April 2015, the Council adopted Decision (CFSP) 2015/598
Council Decision (CFSP) 2015/598 of 15 April 2015 appointing the European Union Special Representative for Central Asia (OJ L 99, 16.4.2015, p. 25). appointing Mr Peter BURIAN as the European Union Special Representative (EUSR) for Central Asia.

On 25 June 2018, the Council adopted Decision (CFSP) 2018/904
Council Decision (CFSP) 2018/904 of 25 June 2018 extending the mandate of the European Union Special Representative for Central Asia (OJ L 161, 26.6.2018, p. 12). extending the mandate of the EUSR for Central Asia. The EUSR's mandate is to expire on 29 February 2020.

The mandate of the EUSR for Central Asia should be extended for a further period of 12 months and a new financial reference amount for the period from 1 March 2020 to 28 February 2021 should be established.

The EUSR for Central Asia will implement the mandate in the context of a situation which may deteriorate and could impede the achievement of the objectives of the Union's external action as set out in Article 21 of the Treaty,

content.p: Article 1 is replaced by the following:

The mandate of Mr Peter BURIAN as the European Union Special Representative (EUSR) for Central Asia is extended until 28 February 2021. The Council may decide that the mandate of the EUSR be terminated earlier, based on an assessment by the Political and Security Committee (PSC) and a proposal from the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy (HR).';
in Article 5(1), the following subparagraph is added:
'The financial reference amount intended to cover the expenditure related to the EUSR's mandate for the period from 1 March 2020 to 28 February 2021 shall be EUR 1170000.';
in Article 14, the following subparagraph is added:
'The final comprehensive mandate implementation report of the EUSR shall be presented by 30 November 2020.'.
This Decision shall enter into force on the date of its adoption. It shall apply from 1 March 2020.
